text.section:
In this section, "defective alarm system" means an alarm system that activates:
more than three false alarms within a 30-day period; or
eight or more false alarms within a 12-month period.

section.section: A law enforcement unit or fire department that responds to false alarms from a defective alarm system shall provide written notice of the defective condition to the alarm user.

The alarm user, within 30 days after receiving the notice, shall:
if qualified, inspect the alarm system; or
have the alarm system inspected by an alarm system contractor; and
within 15 days after the inspection, file with the law enforcement unit or fire department that issued the notice a written report that contains the:
result of the inspection;
probable cause of the false alarms; and
recommendations or action taken to eliminate the false alarms.

text.section: An alarm user may not use a defective alarm system after receiving a written notice under subsection (b) of this section.
A person who violates subsection (c) of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 90 days or a fine not exceeding $500 or both.
